title: Firefox congela todo o sistema do Ubuntu 20.04
content:
Faz algum tempo que, ao usar o Firefox, o meu sistema inteiro trava. Mesmo o mouse só funciona muito lentamente, e eu sempre acabo sendo obrigado a forçar a reinicialização do sistema pelo botão de energia.

Durante uma época, imaginei que fosse uma questão de memória, até perceber que outros navegadores, baseados em Chromium, não causavam esse problema. No momento, por exemplo, uso o Vivaldi Browser com e-mail, calendário, etc, todos ativados e tudo funciona normalmente.

Observei que os travamentos acontecem geralmente quando o Firefox possui mais histórico, cookies e afins salvos, mas nem sempre por uma sobrecarga específica. Por exemplo, posso deixar o computador com algumas abas abertas e já carregadas, sair e encontrar ele completamente paralisado na volta.

Já tentei usar sem extensões (Bitwarden e uBlock origin), resetar o Firefox, começar um perfil novo do zero e mesmo reinstalar o programa. Nada se mostrou efetivo, exceto, talvez, quando configurei para que ele apagasse todos os dados ao reiniciar, mas não testei por tempo suficiente.
creator: liquefeito

title: no encuentro mi carpeta de marcadores
content: hola, no se como pero me ha desaparecido la todos los marcadores que tenía, y me han aparecidos otros, me urge localizar dicha carpeta , espero una pronta respuesta por favor

title: Settings on per-site basis
content: Is there any way to enable/disable the "Allow pages to choose their own fonts, instead of your selections above" setting on a per-site basis? Thanks.
creator: zorkadoo

title: firefox on showing current tab on different account
content:
Just noticed today that Firefox on my work computer (Mac) is adding an icon to the MacOS Dock that opens the URL of the currently active tab from Firefox on my personal computer (also a Mac). Firefox on my work computer is signed into Sync w/ my work Firefox account and Firefox on my personal computer is signed into sync w/ my personal Firefox account. This is crazy and unacceptable.

I have not previously signed into my personal Firefox account on my work computer, the Connected Services section of the Firefox Account Settings for my personal account does not show my work computer and the Connected Services for my work account does not show my personal computer.

Both computers are on the same physical network, but do not otherwise interact.
creator: baronmog

title: 2 step verification
content: My bank and gmail require 2 step verification with option to skip next time. I continue to get same request but not if I use MIcrosoft Edge browser. How can I correct this so can continue to use Firefox. If I cannot correct this, will be forced to use another browser.

title: Extremely urgent

Let me know right away how to remove the mozilla updater from my computer and get back to the firefox browser that works. This is interfering with my web searches and banking. This is extremely urgent.
creator: alubbers

title: Cannot receive sent tabs from iPhone
content:
Hey Guys,

I am having trouble trying to send tabs between my PC, and my iPhone. I can successfully send a tab from my PC, however, when I attempt to send a tab from my iPhone, it won't show up on my PC.

Things I've tried; - Uninstalling/reinstalling Firefox for PC. - Uninstalling/reinstalling Firefox for iPhone. - Signing out then back in on both devices.

Whatever I try, I can only manage to send tabs from the PC to iPhone and not the other way around. When I manually sync from PC, I can (sometimes) see what tabs are open on my phone. I am out of ideas.

Build Versions; PC: 96.0.2 (64-bit) iOS: Firefox Daylight 96.0 (7403)
creator: jordan.keating

title: Spell Check Notification Disappears on Backspace
content: So, I've come to realize that, over a recent PC upgrade, the red, squiggly underline on misspelled words disappears when the Backspace key is hit. I'm glad that Pocket has reappeared on my home page, since I spent hours trying to find it a couple of years ago, unsuccessfully, after it disappeared, but now this spell check issue is a bit disconcerting. But now it appears that it only happens within Facebook ...there's a surprise. Nope, it's Messenger/Firefox only. Messenger/Edge works as it should (red squigglies remain, despite depressing Backspace), and the squigglies also remain within this text field. So it seems specific to Messenger/Firefox. Firefox (96.01)
creator: mnjaskiw
